body.p: We want to extend (some of) the corpus files with markup for spelling and other errors, to use them as gold standards for testing our spellers (and in the future other tools as well). The markup is done manually, and needs to follow certain rules.

dl.dd:
loan | prop | pron | num | acro | abbr | hypcorr
(dette fordi nogle typer ord har mere fejlskrivning end andre typer)

infl | der | phon | orto | punct | ord | dial | typo
infl: fejlen er tilknyttet bøjningen i ordet
der: derivationsfejl, fx manglende derivativ (tilhæng) eller fejl ved affingering
phon: fejlen er tilknyttet fonetik/fonologi
orto: fejlen er tilknyttet retskrivningens konventioner, eks. dér, hvor ortografien bryder med fonologien
punct: fejlen er tilknyttet interpunktion
ord: fejlen er tilknyttet ordenstal
dial: dialektal fejl
typo: tastefejl
hypcorr: hyperkorrektion

ul.li: typo = typical typo — as a POS value?
mix = used with errtype=ncmp, since the correct form is made of several words/POS's. Problem: there is no such errtype value, only wcmp and cmp.

body.p: By following these guidelines the resulting files should be readily usable for (speller) testing, as soon as they are converted to xml.
